53/*! \file
54 * \brief
55 * Outgoing AXFR and IXFR.
56 */
57
58/*
59 * TODO:
60 * - IXFR over UDP
61 */
62
63#define XFROUT_COMMON_LOGARGS \
64 ns_lctx, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_XFER_OUT, NS_LOGMODULE_XFER_OUT
65
66#define XFROUT_PROTOCOL_LOGARGS \
67 XFROUT_COMMON_LOGARGS, ISC_LOG_INFO
68
69#define XFROUT_DEBUG_LOGARGS(n) \
70 XFROUT_COMMON_LOGARGS, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(n)
71
72#define XFROUT_RR_LOGARGS \
73 XFROUT_COMMON_LOGARGS, XFROUT_RR_LOGLEVEL
74
75#define XFROUT_RR_LOGLEVEL ISC_LOG_DEBUG(8)
76
77/*%
78 * Fail unconditionally and log as a client error.
79 * The test against ISC_R_SUCCESS is there to keep the Solaris compiler
80 * from complaining about "end-of-loop code not reached".
81 */
82#define FAILC(code, msg) \
83 do { \
84 result = (code); \
85 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_XFER_OUT, \
86 NS_LOGMODULE_XFER_OUT, ISC_LOG_INFO, \
87 "bad zone transfer request: %s (%s)", \
88 msg, isc_result_totext(code)); \
89 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
90 } while (0)
91
92#define FAILQ(code, msg, question, rdclass) \
93 do { \
94 char _buf1[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE]; \
95 char _buf2[DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE]; \
96 result = (code); \
97 dns_name_format(question, _buf1, sizeof(_buf1)); \
98 dns_rdataclass_format(rdclass, _buf2, sizeof(_buf2)); \
99 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_XFER_OUT, \
100 NS_LOGMODULE_XFER_OUT, ISC_LOG_INFO, \
101 "bad zone transfer request: '%s/%s': %s (%s)", \
102 _buf1, _buf2, msg, isc_result_totext(code)); \
103 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
104 } while (0)
105
106#define CHECK(op) \
107 do { result = (op); \
108 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) goto failure; \
109 } while (0)
110
111/**************************************************************************/
112
113static inline void
114inc_stats(ns_client_t *client, dns_zone_t *zone, isc_statscounter_t counter) {
115 ns_stats_increment(client->sctx->nsstats, counter);
116 if (zone != NULL) {
117 isc_stats_t *zonestats = dns_zone_getrequeststats(zone);
118 if (zonestats != NULL)
119 isc_stats_increment(zonestats, counter);
120 }
121}
122
123/**************************************************************************/
124
125/*% Log an RR (for debugging) */
126
127static void
128log_rr(dns_name_t *name, dns_rdata_t *rdata, uint32_t ttl) {
129 isc_result_t result;
130 isc_buffer_t buf;
131 char mem[2000];
132 dns_rdatalist_t rdl;
133 dns_rdataset_t rds;
134 dns_rdata_t rd = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
135
136 dns_rdatalist_init(&rdl);
137 rdl.type = rdata->type;
138 rdl.rdclass = rdata->rdclass;
139 rdl.ttl = ttl;
140 if (rdata->type == dns_rdatatype_sig ||
141 rdata->type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig)
142 rdl.covers = dns_rdata_covers(rdata);
143 else
144 rdl.covers = dns_rdatatype_none;
145 dns_rdataset_init(&rds);
146 dns_rdata_init(&rd);
147 dns_rdata_clone(rdata, &rd);
148 ISC_LIST_APPEND(rdl.rdata, &rd, link);
149 RUNTIME_CHECK(dns_rdatalist_tordataset(&rdl, &rds) == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
150
151 isc_buffer_init(&buf, mem, sizeof(mem));
152 result = dns_rdataset_totext(&rds, name,
153 false, false, &buf);
154
155 /*
156 * We could use xfrout_log(), but that would produce
157 * very long lines with a repetitive prefix.
158 */
159 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
160 /*
161 * Get rid of final newline.
162 */
163 INSIST(buf.used >= 1 &&
164 ((char *) buf.base)[buf.used - 1] == '\n');
165 buf.used--;
166
167 isc_log_write(XFROUT_RR_LOGARGS, "%.*s",
168 (int)isc_buffer_usedlength(&buf),
169 (char *)isc_buffer_base(&buf));
170 } else {
171 isc_log_write(XFROUT_RR_LOGARGS, "<RR too large to print>");
172 }
173}
174
175/**************************************************************************/
176/*
177 * An 'rrstream_t' is a polymorphic iterator that returns
178 * a stream of resource records. There are multiple implementations,
179 * e.g. for generating AXFR and IXFR records streams.
180 */
181
182typedef struct rrstream_methods rrstream_methods_t;
183
184typedef struct rrstream {
185 isc_mem_t *mctx;
186 rrstream_methods_t *methods;
187} rrstream_t;
188
189struct rrstream_methods {
190 isc_result_t (*first)(rrstream_t *);
191 isc_result_t (*next)(rrstream_t *);
192 void (*current)(rrstream_t *,
193 dns_name_t **,
194 uint32_t *,
195 dns_rdata_t **);
196 void (*pause)(rrstream_t *);
197 void (*destroy)(rrstream_t **);
198};
199
200static void
201rrstream_noop_pause(rrstream_t *rs) {
202 UNUSED(rs);
203}
204
205/**************************************************************************/
206/*
207 * An 'ixfr_rrstream_t' is an 'rrstream_t' that returns
208 * an IXFR-like RR stream from a journal file.
209 *
210 * The SOA at the beginning of each sequence of additions
211 * or deletions are included in the stream, but the extra
212 * SOAs at the beginning and end of the entire transfer are
213 * not included.
214 */
215
216typedef struct ixfr_rrstream {
217 rrstream_t common;
218 dns_journal_t *journal;
219} ixfr_rrstream_t;
220
221/* Forward declarations. */
222static void
223ixfr_rrstream_destroy(rrstream_t **sp);
224
225static rrstream_methods_t ixfr_rrstream_methods;
226
227/*
228 * Returns: anything dns_journal_open() or dns_journal_iter_init()
229 * may return.
230 */
231
232static isc_result_t
233ixfr_rrstream_create(isc_mem_t *mctx,
234 const char *journal_filename,
235 uint32_t begin_serial,
236 uint32_t end_serial,
237 rrstream_t **sp)
238{
239 ixfr_rrstream_t *s;
240 isc_result_t result;
241
242 INSIST(sp != NULL && *sp == NULL);
243
244 s = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*s));
245 if (s == NULL)
246 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
247 s->common.mctx = NULL;
248 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &s->common.mctx);
249 s->common.methods = &ixfr_rrstream_methods;
250 s->journal = NULL;
251
252 CHECK(dns_journal_open(mctx, journal_filename,
253 DNS_JOURNAL_READ, &s->journal));
254 CHECK(dns_journal_iter_init(s->journal, begin_serial, end_serial));
255
256 *sp = (rrstream_t *) s;
257 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
258
259 failure:
260 ixfr_rrstream_destroy((rrstream_t **) (void *)&s);
261 return (result);
262}
263
264static isc_result_t
265ixfr_rrstream_first(rrstream_t *rs) {
266 ixfr_rrstream_t *s = (ixfr_rrstream_t *) rs;
267 return (dns_journal_first_rr(s->journal));
268}
269
270static isc_result_t
271ixfr_rrstream_next(rrstream_t *rs) {
272 ixfr_rrstream_t *s = (ixfr_rrstream_t *) rs;
273 return (dns_journal_next_rr(s->journal));
274}
275
276static void
277ixfr_rrstream_current(rrstream_t *rs,
278 dns_name_t **name, uint32_t *ttl,
279 dns_rdata_t **rdata)
280{
281 ixfr_rrstream_t *s = (ixfr_rrstream_t *) rs;
282 dns_journal_current_rr(s->journal, name, ttl, rdata);
283}
284
285static void
286ixfr_rrstream_destroy(rrstream_t **rsp) {
287 ixfr_rrstream_t *s = (ixfr_rrstream_t *) *rsp;
288 if (s->journal != 0)
289 dns_journal_destroy(&s->journal);
290 isc_mem_putanddetach(&s->common.mctx, s, sizeof(*s));
291}
292
293static rrstream_methods_t ixfr_rrstream_methods = {
294 ixfr_rrstream_first,
295 ixfr_rrstream_next,
296 ixfr_rrstream_current,
297 rrstream_noop_pause,
298 ixfr_rrstream_destroy
299};
300
301/**************************************************************************/
302/*
303 * An 'axfr_rrstream_t' is an 'rrstream_t' that returns
304 * an AXFR-like RR stream from a database.
305 *
306 * The SOAs at the beginning and end of the transfer are
307 * not included in the stream.
308 */
309
310typedef struct axfr_rrstream {
311 rrstream_t common;
312 dns_rriterator_t it;
313 bool it_valid;
314} axfr_rrstream_t;
315
316/*
317 * Forward declarations.
318 */
319static void
320axfr_rrstream_destroy(rrstream_t **rsp);
321
322static rrstream_methods_t axfr_rrstream_methods;
323
324static isc_result_t
325axfr_rrstream_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver,
326 rrstream_t **sp)
327{
328 axfr_rrstream_t *s;
329 isc_result_t result;
330
331 INSIST(sp != NULL && *sp == NULL);
332
333 s = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*s));
334 if (s == NULL)
335 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
336 s->common.mctx = NULL;
337 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &s->common.mctx);
338 s->common.methods = &axfr_rrstream_methods;
339 s->it_valid = false;
340
341 CHECK(dns_rriterator_init(&s->it, db, ver, 0));
342 s->it_valid = true;
343
344 *sp = (rrstream_t *) s;
345 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
346
347 failure:
348 axfr_rrstream_destroy((rrstream_t **) (void *)&s);
349 return (result);
350}
351
352static isc_result_t
353axfr_rrstream_first(rrstream_t *rs) {
354 axfr_rrstream_t *s = (axfr_rrstream_t *) rs;
355 isc_result_t result;
356 result = dns_rriterator_first(&s->it);
357 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
358 return (result);
359 /* Skip SOA records. */
360 for (;;) {
361 dns_name_t *name_dummy = NULL;
362 uint32_t ttl_dummy;
363 dns_rdata_t *rdata = NULL;
364 dns_rriterator_current(&s->it, &name_dummy,
365 &ttl_dummy, NULL, &rdata);
366 if (rdata->type != dns_rdatatype_soa)
367 break;
368 result = dns_rriterator_next(&s->it);
369 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
370 break;
371 }
372 return (result);
373}
374
375static isc_result_t
376axfr_rrstream_next(rrstream_t *rs) {
377 axfr_rrstream_t *s = (axfr_rrstream_t *) rs;
378 isc_result_t result;
379
380 /* Skip SOA records. */
381 for (;;) {
382 dns_name_t *name_dummy = NULL;
383 uint32_t ttl_dummy;
384 dns_rdata_t *rdata = NULL;
385 result = dns_rriterator_next(&s->it);
386 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
387 break;
388 dns_rriterator_current(&s->it, &name_dummy,
389 &ttl_dummy, NULL, &rdata);
390 if (rdata->type != dns_rdatatype_soa)
391 break;
392 }
393 return (result);
394}
395
396static void
397axfr_rrstream_current(rrstream_t *rs, dns_name_t **name, uint32_t *ttl,
398 dns_rdata_t **rdata)
399{
400 axfr_rrstream_t *s = (axfr_rrstream_t *) rs;
401 dns_rriterator_current(&s->it, name, ttl, NULL, rdata);
402}
403
404static void
405axfr_rrstream_pause(rrstream_t *rs) {
406 axfr_rrstream_t *s = (axfr_rrstream_t *) rs;
407 dns_rriterator_pause(&s->it);
408}
409
410static void
411axfr_rrstream_destroy(rrstream_t **rsp) {
412 axfr_rrstream_t *s = (axfr_rrstream_t *) *rsp;
413 if (s->it_valid)
414 dns_rriterator_destroy(&s->it);
415 isc_mem_putanddetach(&s->common.mctx, s, sizeof(*s));
416}
417
418static rrstream_methods_t axfr_rrstream_methods = {
419 axfr_rrstream_first,
420 axfr_rrstream_next,
421 axfr_rrstream_current,
422 axfr_rrstream_pause,
423 axfr_rrstream_destroy
424};
425
426/**************************************************************************/
427/*
428 * An 'soa_rrstream_t' is a degenerate 'rrstream_t' that returns
429 * a single SOA record.
430 */
431
432typedef struct soa_rrstream {
433 rrstream_t common;
434 dns_difftuple_t *soa_tuple;
435} soa_rrstream_t;
436
437/*
438 * Forward declarations.
439 */
440static void
441soa_rrstream_destroy(rrstream_t **rsp);
442
443static rrstream_methods_t soa_rrstream_methods;
444
445static isc_result_t
446soa_rrstream_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver,
447 rrstream_t **sp)
448{
449 soa_rrstream_t *s;
450 isc_result_t result;
451
452 INSIST(sp != NULL && *sp == NULL);
453
454 s = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*s));
455 if (s == NULL)
456 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
457 s->common.mctx = NULL;
458 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &s->common.mctx);
459 s->common.methods = &soa_rrstream_methods;
460 s->soa_tuple = NULL;
461
462 CHECK(dns_db_createsoatuple(db, ver, mctx, DNS_DIFFOP_EXISTS,
463 &s->soa_tuple));
464
465 *sp = (rrstream_t *) s;
466 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
467
468 failure:
469 soa_rrstream_destroy((rrstream_t **) (void *)&s);
470 return (result);
471}
472
473static isc_result_t
474soa_rrstream_first(rrstream_t *rs) {
475 UNUSED(rs);
476 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
477}
478
479static isc_result_t
480soa_rrstream_next(rrstream_t *rs) {
481 UNUSED(rs);
482 return (ISC_R_NOMORE);
483}
484
485static void
486soa_rrstream_current(rrstream_t *rs, dns_name_t **name, uint32_t *ttl,
487 dns_rdata_t **rdata)
488{
489 soa_rrstream_t *s = (soa_rrstream_t *) rs;
490 *name = &s->soa_tuple->name;
491 *ttl = s->soa_tuple->ttl;
492 *rdata = &s->soa_tuple->rdata;
493}
494
495static void
496soa_rrstream_destroy(rrstream_t **rsp) {
497 soa_rrstream_t *s = (soa_rrstream_t *) *rsp;
498 if (s->soa_tuple != NULL)
499 dns_difftuple_free(&s->soa_tuple);
500 isc_mem_putanddetach(&s->common.mctx, s, sizeof(*s));
501}
502
503static rrstream_methods_t soa_rrstream_methods = {
504 soa_rrstream_first,
505 soa_rrstream_next,
506 soa_rrstream_current,
507 rrstream_noop_pause,
508 soa_rrstream_destroy
509};
510
511/**************************************************************************/
512/*
513 * A 'compound_rrstream_t' objects owns a soa_rrstream
514 * and another rrstream, the "data stream". It returns
515 * a concatenated stream consisting of the soa_rrstream, then
516 * the data stream, then the soa_rrstream again.
517 *
518 * The component streams are owned by the compound_rrstream_t
519 * and are destroyed with it.
520 */
521
522typedef struct compound_rrstream {
523 rrstream_t common;
524 rrstream_t *components[3];
525 int state;
526 isc_result_t result;
527} compound_rrstream_t;
528
529/*
530 * Forward declarations.
531 */
532static void
533compound_rrstream_destroy(rrstream_t **rsp);
534
535static isc_result_t
536compound_rrstream_next(rrstream_t *rs);
537
538static rrstream_methods_t compound_rrstream_methods;
539
540/*
541 * Requires:
542 * soa_stream != NULL && *soa_stream != NULL
543 * data_stream != NULL && *data_stream != NULL
544 * sp != NULL && *sp == NULL
545 *
546 * Ensures:
547 * *soa_stream == NULL
548 * *data_stream == NULL
549 * *sp points to a valid compound_rrstream_t
550 * The soa and data streams will be destroyed
551 * when the compound_rrstream_t is destroyed.
552 */
553static isc_result_t
554compound_rrstream_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, rrstream_t **soa_stream,
555 rrstream_t **data_stream, rrstream_t **sp)
556{
557 compound_rrstream_t *s;
558
559 INSIST(sp != NULL && *sp == NULL);
560
561 s = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*s));
562 if (s == NULL)
563 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
564 s->common.mctx = NULL;
565 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &s->common.mctx);
566 s->common.methods = &compound_rrstream_methods;
567 s->components[0] = *soa_stream;
568 s->components[1] = *data_stream;
569 s->components[2] = *soa_stream;
570 s->state = -1;
571 s->result = ISC_R_FAILURE;
572
573 *soa_stream = NULL;
574 *data_stream = NULL;
575 *sp = (rrstream_t *) s;
576 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
577}
578
579static isc_result_t
580compound_rrstream_first(rrstream_t *rs) {
581 compound_rrstream_t *s = (compound_rrstream_t *) rs;
582 s->state = 0;
583 do {
584 rrstream_t *curstream = s->components[s->state];
585 s->result = curstream->methods->first(curstream);
586 } while (s->result == ISC_R_NOMORE && s->state < 2);
587 return (s->result);
588}
589
590static isc_result_t
591compound_rrstream_next(rrstream_t *rs) {
592 compound_rrstream_t *s = (compound_rrstream_t *) rs;
593 rrstream_t *curstream = s->components[s->state];
594 s->result = curstream->methods->next(curstream);
595 while (s->result == ISC_R_NOMORE) {
596 /*
597 * Make sure locks held by the current stream
598 * are released before we switch streams.
599 */
600 curstream->methods->pause(curstream);
601 if (s->state == 2)
602 return (ISC_R_NOMORE);
603 s->state++;
604 curstream = s->components[s->state];
605 s->result = curstream->methods->first(curstream);
606 }
607 return (s->result);
608}
609
610static void
611compound_rrstream_current(rrstream_t *rs, dns_name_t **name, uint32_t *ttl,
612 dns_rdata_t **rdata)
613{
614 compound_rrstream_t *s = (compound_rrstream_t *) rs;
615 rrstream_t *curstream;
616 INSIST(0 <= s->state && s->state < 3);
617 INSIST(s->result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
618 curstream = s->components[s->state];
619 curstream->methods->current(curstream, name, ttl, rdata);
620}
621
622static void
623compound_rrstream_pause(rrstream_t *rs)
624{
625 compound_rrstream_t *s = (compound_rrstream_t *) rs;
626 rrstream_t *curstream;
627 INSIST(0 <= s->state && s->state < 3);
628 curstream = s->components[s->state];
629 curstream->methods->pause(curstream);
630}
631
632static void
633compound_rrstream_destroy(rrstream_t **rsp) {
634 compound_rrstream_t *s = (compound_rrstream_t *) *rsp;
635 s->components[0]->methods->destroy(&s->components[0]);
636 s->components[1]->methods->destroy(&s->components[1]);
637 s->components[2] = NULL; /* Copy of components[0]. */
638 isc_mem_putanddetach(&s->common.mctx, s, sizeof(*s));
639}
640
641static rrstream_methods_t compound_rrstream_methods = {
642 compound_rrstream_first,
643 compound_rrstream_next,
644 compound_rrstream_current,
645 compound_rrstream_pause,
646 compound_rrstream_destroy
647};
648
649/**************************************************************************/
650
651/*%
652 * Structure holding outgoing transfer statistics
653 */
654struct xfr_stats {
655 uint64_t nmsg; /*%< Number of messages sent */
656 uint64_t nrecs; /*%< Number of records sent */
657 uint64_t nbytes; /*%< Number of bytes sent */
658 isc_time_t start; /*%< Start time of the transfer */
659 isc_time_t end; /*%< End time of the transfer */
660};
661
662/*%
663 * An 'xfrout_ctx_t' contains the state of an outgoing AXFR or IXFR
664 * in progress.
665 */
666typedef struct {
667 isc_mem_t *mctx;
668 ns_client_t *client;
669 unsigned int id; /* ID of request */
670 dns_name_t *qname; /* Question name of request */
671 dns_rdatatype_t qtype; /* dns_rdatatype_{a,i}xfr */
672 dns_rdataclass_t qclass;
673 dns_zone_t *zone; /* (necessary for stats) */
674 dns_db_t *db;
675 dns_dbversion_t *ver;
676 isc_quota_t *quota;
677 rrstream_t *stream; /* The XFR RR stream */
678 bool question_added; /* QUESTION section sent? */
679 bool end_of_stream; /* EOS has been reached */
680 isc_buffer_t buf; /* Buffer for message owner
681 names and rdatas */
682 isc_buffer_t txlenbuf; /* Transmit length buffer */
683 isc_buffer_t txbuf; /* Transmit message buffer */
684 void *txmem;
685 unsigned int txmemlen;
686 dns_tsigkey_t *tsigkey; /* Key used to create TSIG */
687 isc_buffer_t *lasttsig; /* the last TSIG */
688 bool verified_tsig; /* verified request MAC */
689 bool many_answers;
690 int sends; /* Send in progress */
691 bool shuttingdown;
692 const char *mnemonic; /* Style of transfer */
693 struct xfr_stats stats; /*%< Transfer statistics */
694} xfrout_ctx_t;
695
696static isc_result_t
697xfrout_ctx_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, ns_client_t *client,
698 unsigned int id, dns_name_t *qname, dns_rdatatype_t qtype,
699 dns_rdataclass_t qclass, dns_zone_t *zone,
700 dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, isc_quota_t *quota,
701 rrstream_t *stream, dns_tsigkey_t *tsigkey,
702 isc_buffer_t *lasttsig,
703 bool verified_tsig,
704 unsigned int maxtime,
705 unsigned int idletime,
706 bool many_answers,
707 xfrout_ctx_t **xfrp);
708
709static void
710sendstream(xfrout_ctx_t *xfr);
711
712static void
713xfrout_senddone(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event);
714
715static void
716xfrout_fail(xfrout_ctx_t *xfr, isc_result_t result, const char *msg);
717
718static void
719xfrout_maybe_destroy(xfrout_ctx_t *xfr);
720
721static void
722xfrout_ctx_destroy(xfrout_ctx_t **xfrp);
723
724static void
725xfrout_client_shutdown(void *arg, isc_result_t result);
726
727static void
728xfrout_log1(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t *zonename,
729 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass, int level,
730 const char *fmt, ...) ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(5, 6);
731
732static void
733xfrout_log(xfrout_ctx_t *xfr, int level, const char *fmt, ...)
734 ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(3, 4);
735
736/**************************************************************************/
737
738void
739ns_xfr_start(ns_client_t *client, dns_rdatatype_t reqtype) {
740 isc_result_t result;
741 dns_name_t *question_name;
742 dns_rdataset_t *question_rdataset;
743 dns_zone_t *zone = NULL, *raw = NULL, *mayberaw;
744 dns_db_t *db = NULL;
745 dns_dbversion_t *ver = NULL;
746 dns_rdataclass_t question_class;
747 rrstream_t *soa_stream = NULL;
748 rrstream_t *data_stream = NULL;
749 rrstream_t *stream = NULL;
750 dns_difftuple_t *current_soa_tuple = NULL;
751 dns_name_t *soa_name;
752 dns_rdataset_t *soa_rdataset;
753 dns_rdata_t soa_rdata = DNS_RDATA_INIT;
754 bool have_soa = false;
755 const char *mnemonic = NULL;
756 isc_mem_t *mctx = client->mctx;
757 dns_message_t *request = client->message;
758 xfrout_ctx_t *xfr = NULL;
759 isc_quota_t *quota = NULL;
760 dns_transfer_format_t format = client->view->transfer_format;
761 isc_netaddr_t na;
762 dns_peer_t *peer = NULL;
763 isc_buffer_t *tsigbuf = NULL;
764 char *journalfile;
765 char msg[NS_CLIENT_ACLMSGSIZE("zone transfer")];
766 char keyname[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
767 bool is_poll = false;
768 bool is_dlz = false;
769 bool is_ixfr = false;
770 uint32_t begin_serial = 0, current_serial;
771
772 switch (reqtype) {
773 case dns_rdatatype_axfr:
774 mnemonic = "AXFR";
775 break;
776 case dns_rdatatype_ixfr:
777 mnemonic = "IXFR";
778 break;
779 default:
780 INSIST(0);
781 ISC_UNREACHABLE();
782 }
783
784 ns_client_log(client,
785 DNS_LOGCATEGORY_XFER_OUT, NS_LOGMODULE_XFER_OUT,
786 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(6), "%s request", mnemonic);
787 /*
788 * Apply quota.
789 */
790 result = isc_quota_attach(&client->sctx->xfroutquota, &quota);
791 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
792 isc_log_write(XFROUT_COMMON_LOGARGS, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
793 "%s request denied: %s", mnemonic,
794 isc_result_totext(result));
795 goto failure;
796 }
797
798 /*
799 * Interpret the question section.
800 */
801 result = dns_message_firstname(request, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION);
802 INSIST(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
803
804 /*
805 * The question section must contain exactly one question, and
806 * it must be for AXFR/IXFR as appropriate.
807 */
808 question_name = NULL;
809 dns_message_currentname(request, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION, &question_name);
810 question_rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(question_name->list);
811 question_class = question_rdataset->rdclass;
812 INSIST(question_rdataset->type == reqtype);
813 if (ISC_LIST_NEXT(question_rdataset, link) != NULL)
814 FAILC(DNS_R_FORMERR, "multiple questions");
815 result = dns_message_nextname(request, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION);
816 if (result != ISC_R_NOMORE)
817 FAILC(DNS_R_FORMERR, "multiple questions");
818
819 result = dns_zt_find(client->view->zonetable, question_name, 0, NULL,
820 &zone);
821
822 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS || dns_zone_gettype(zone) == dns_zone_dlz) {
823 /*
824 * The normal zone table does not have a match, or this is
825 * marked in the zone table as a DLZ zone. Check the DLZ
826 * databases for a match.
827 */
828 if (! ISC_LIST_EMPTY(client->view->dlz_searched)) {
829 result = dns_dlzallowzonexfr(client->view,
830 question_name,
831 &client->peeraddr,
832 &db);
833
834 if (result == ISC_R_NOPERM) {
835 char _buf1[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
836 char _buf2[DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE];
837
838 result = DNS_R_REFUSED;
839 dns_name_format(question_name, _buf1,
840 sizeof(_buf1));
841 dns_rdataclass_format(question_class,
842 _buf2, sizeof(_buf2));
843 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_SECURITY,
844 NS_LOGMODULE_XFER_OUT,
845 ISC_LOG_ERROR,
846 "zone transfer '%s/%s' denied",
847 _buf1, _buf2);
848 goto failure;
849 }
850 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
851 FAILQ(DNS_R_NOTAUTH, "non-authoritative zone",
852 question_name, question_class);
853 is_dlz = true;
854 } else {
855 /*
856 * not DLZ and not in normal zone table, we are
857 * not authoritative
858 */
859 FAILQ(DNS_R_NOTAUTH, "non-authoritative zone",
860 question_name, question_class);
861 }
862 } else {
863 /* zone table has a match */
864 switch(dns_zone_gettype(zone)) {
865 /*
866 * Master, slave, and mirror zones are OK for transfer.
867 */
868 case dns_zone_master:
869 case dns_zone_slave:
870 case dns_zone_mirror:
871 case dns_zone_dlz:
872 break;
873 default:
874 FAILQ(DNS_R_NOTAUTH, "non-authoritative zone",
875 question_name, question_class);
876 }
877 CHECK(dns_zone_getdb(zone, &db));
878 dns_db_currentversion(db, &ver);
879 }
880
881 xfrout_log1(client, question_name, question_class, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(6),
882 "%s question section OK", mnemonic);
883
884 /*
885 * Check the authority section. Look for a SOA record with
886 * the same name and class as the question.
887 */
888 for (result = dns_message_firstname(request, DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY);
889 result == ISC_R_SUCCESS;
890 result = dns_message_nextname(request, DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY))
891 {
892 soa_name = NULL;
893 dns_message_currentname(request, DNS_SECTION_AUTHORITY,
894 &soa_name);
895
896 /*
897 * Ignore data whose owner name is not the zone apex.
898 */
899 if (! dns_name_equal(soa_name, question_name))
900 continue;
901
902 for (soa_rdataset = ISC_LIST_HEAD(soa_name->list);
903 soa_rdataset != NULL;
904 soa_rdataset = ISC_LIST_NEXT(soa_rdataset, link))
905 {
906 /*
907 * Ignore non-SOA data.
908 */
909 if (soa_rdataset->type != dns_rdatatype_soa)
910 continue;
911 if (soa_rdataset->rdclass != question_class)
912 continue;
913
914 CHECK(dns_rdataset_first(soa_rdataset));
915 dns_rdataset_current(soa_rdataset, &soa_rdata);
916 result = dns_rdataset_next(soa_rdataset);
917 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
918 FAILC(DNS_R_FORMERR,
919 "IXFR authority section "
920 "has multiple SOAs");
921 have_soa = true;
922 goto got_soa;
923 }
924 }
925 got_soa:
926 if (result != ISC_R_NOMORE)
927 CHECK(result);
928
929 xfrout_log1(client, question_name, question_class, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(6),
930 "%s authority section OK", mnemonic);
931
932 /*
933 * If not a DLZ zone, decide whether to allow this transfer.
934 */
935 if (!is_dlz) {
936 ns_client_aclmsg("zone transfer", question_name, reqtype,
937 client->view->rdclass, msg, sizeof(msg));
938 CHECK(ns_client_checkacl(client, NULL, msg,
939 dns_zone_getxfracl(zone),
940 true, ISC_LOG_ERROR));
941 }
942
943 /*
944 * AXFR over UDP is not possible.
945 */
946 if (reqtype == dns_rdatatype_axfr &&
947 (client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP) == 0)
948 FAILC(DNS_R_FORMERR, "attempted AXFR over UDP");
949
950 /*
951 * Look up the requesting server in the peer table.
952 */
953 isc_netaddr_fromsockaddr(&na, &client->peeraddr);
954 (void)dns_peerlist_peerbyaddr(client->view->peers, &na, &peer);
955
956 /*
957 * Decide on the transfer format (one-answer or many-answers).
958 */
959 if (peer != NULL)
960 (void)dns_peer_gettransferformat(peer, &format);
961
962 /*
963 * Get a dynamically allocated copy of the current SOA.
964 */
965 if (is_dlz)
966 dns_db_currentversion(db, &ver);
967
968 CHECK(dns_db_createsoatuple(db, ver, mctx, DNS_DIFFOP_EXISTS,
969 &current_soa_tuple));
970
971 current_serial = dns_soa_getserial(&current_soa_tuple->rdata);
972 if (reqtype == dns_rdatatype_ixfr) {
973 bool provide_ixfr;
974
975 /*
976 * Outgoing IXFR may have been disabled for this peer
977 * or globally.
978 */
979 provide_ixfr = client->view->provideixfr;
980 if (peer != NULL)
981 (void) dns_peer_getprovideixfr(peer, &provide_ixfr);
982 if (provide_ixfr == false)
983 goto axfr_fallback;
984
985 if (! have_soa)
986 FAILC(DNS_R_FORMERR,
987 "IXFR request missing SOA");
988
989 begin_serial = dns_soa_getserial(&soa_rdata);
990
991 /*
992 * RFC1995 says "If an IXFR query with the same or
993 * newer version number than that of the server
994 * is received, it is replied to with a single SOA
995 * record of the server's current version, just as
996 * in AXFR". The claim about AXFR is incorrect,
997 * but other than that, we do as the RFC says.
998 *
999 * Sending a single SOA record is also how we refuse
1000 * IXFR over UDP (currently, we always do).
1001 */
1002 if (DNS_SERIAL_GE(begin_serial, current_serial) ||
1003 (client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP) == 0)
1004 {
1005 CHECK(soa_rrstream_create(mctx, db, ver, &stream));
1006 is_poll = true;
1007 goto have_stream;
1008 }
1009 journalfile = is_dlz ? NULL : dns_zone_getjournal(zone);
1010 if (journalfile != NULL)
1011 result = ixfr_rrstream_create(mctx,
1012 journalfile,
1013 begin_serial,
1014 current_serial,
1015 &data_stream);
1016 else
1017 result = ISC_R_NOTFOUND;
1018 if (result == ISC_R_NOTFOUND ||
1019 result == ISC_R_RANGE) {
1020 xfrout_log1(client, question_name, question_class,
1021 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(4),
1022 "IXFR version not in journal, "
1023 "falling back to AXFR");
1024 mnemonic = "AXFR-style IXFR";
1025 goto axfr_fallback;
1026 }
1027 CHECK(result);
1028 is_ixfr = true;
1029 } else {
1030 axfr_fallback:
1031 CHECK(axfr_rrstream_create(mctx, db, ver, &data_stream));
1032 }
1033
1034 /*
1035 * Bracket the data stream with SOAs.
1036 */
1037 CHECK(soa_rrstream_create(mctx, db, ver, &soa_stream));
1038 CHECK(compound_rrstream_create(mctx, &soa_stream, &data_stream,
1039 &stream));
1040 soa_stream = NULL;
1041 data_stream = NULL;
1042
1043 have_stream:
1044 CHECK(dns_message_getquerytsig(request, mctx, &tsigbuf));
1045 /*
1046 * Create the xfrout context object. This transfers the ownership
1047 * of "stream", "db", "ver", and "quota" to the xfrout context object.
1048 */
1049
1050
1051
1052 if (is_dlz)
1053 CHECK(xfrout_ctx_create(mctx, client, request->id,
1054 question_name, reqtype, question_class,
1055 zone, db, ver, quota, stream,
1056 dns_message_gettsigkey(request),
1057 tsigbuf,
1058 request->verified_sig,
1059 3600,
1060 3600,
1061 (format == dns_many_answers) ?
1062 true : false,
1063 &xfr));
1064 else
1065 CHECK(xfrout_ctx_create(mctx, client, request->id,
1066 question_name, reqtype, question_class,
1067 zone, db, ver, quota, stream,
1068 dns_message_gettsigkey(request),
1069 tsigbuf,
1070 request->verified_sig,
1071 dns_zone_getmaxxfrout(zone),
1072 dns_zone_getidleout(zone),
1073 (format == dns_many_answers) ?
1074 true : false,
1075 &xfr));
1076
1077 xfr->mnemonic = mnemonic;
1078 stream = NULL;
1079 quota = NULL;
1080
1081 CHECK(xfr->stream->methods->first(xfr->stream));
1082
1083 if (xfr->tsigkey != NULL)
1084 dns_name_format(&xfr->tsigkey->name, keyname, sizeof(keyname));
1085 else
1086 keyname[0] = '\0';
1087 if (is_poll)
1088 xfrout_log1(client, question_name, question_class,
1089 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(1), "IXFR poll up to date%s%s",
1090 (xfr->tsigkey != NULL) ? ": TSIG " : "", keyname);
1091 else if (is_ixfr)
1092 xfrout_log1(client, question_name, question_class,
1093 ISC_LOG_INFO, "%s started%s%s (serial %u -> %u)",
1094 mnemonic, (xfr->tsigkey != NULL) ? ": TSIG " : "",
1095 keyname, begin_serial, current_serial);
1096 else
1097 xfrout_log1(client, question_name, question_class,
1098 ISC_LOG_INFO, "%s started%s%s (serial %u)",
1099 mnemonic, (xfr->tsigkey != NULL) ? ": TSIG " : "",
1100 keyname, current_serial);
1101
1102
1103 if (zone != NULL) {
1104 dns_zone_getraw(zone, &raw);
1105 mayberaw = (raw != NULL) ? raw : zone;
1106 if ((client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTEXPIRE) != 0 &&
1107 (dns_zone_gettype(mayberaw) == dns_zone_slave ||
1108 dns_zone_gettype(mayberaw) == dns_zone_mirror))
1109 {
1110 isc_time_t expiretime;
1111 uint32_t secs;
1112 dns_zone_getexpiretime(zone, &expiretime);
1113 secs = isc_time_seconds(&expiretime);
1114 if (secs >= client->now && result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1115 client->attributes |= NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVEEXPIRE;
1116 client->expire = secs - client->now;
1117 }
1118 }
1119 if (raw != NULL)
1120 dns_zone_detach(&raw);
1121 }
1122
1123 /*
1124 * Hand the context over to sendstream(). Set xfr to NULL;
1125 * sendstream() is responsible for either passing the
1126 * context on to a later event handler or destroying it.
1127 */
1128 sendstream(xfr);
1129 xfr = NULL;
1130
1131 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1132
1133 failure:
1134 if (result == DNS_R_REFUSED)
1135 inc_stats(client, zone, ns_statscounter_xfrrej);
1136 if (quota != NULL)
1137 isc_quota_detach(&quota);
1138 if (current_soa_tuple != NULL)
1139 dns_difftuple_free(&current_soa_tuple);
1140 if (stream != NULL)
1141 stream->methods->destroy(&stream);
1142 if (soa_stream != NULL)
1143 soa_stream->methods->destroy(&soa_stream);
1144 if (data_stream != NULL)
1145 data_stream->methods->destroy(&data_stream);
1146 if (ver != NULL)
1147 dns_db_closeversion(db, &ver, false);
1148 if (db != NULL)
1149 dns_db_detach(&db);
1150 if (zone != NULL)
1151 dns_zone_detach(&zone);
1152 /* XXX kludge */
1153 if (xfr != NULL) {
1154 xfrout_fail(xfr, result, "setting up zone transfer");
1155 } else if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1156 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_XFER_OUT,
1157 NS_LOGMODULE_XFER_OUT,
1158 ISC_LOG_DEBUG(3), "zone transfer setup failed");
1159 ns_client_error(client, result);
1160 }
1161}
1162
1163static isc_result_t
1164xfrout_ctx_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, ns_client_t *client, unsigned int id,
1165 dns_name_t *qname, dns_rdatatype_t qtype,
1166 dns_rdataclass_t qclass, dns_zone_t *zone,
1167 dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, isc_quota_t *quota,
1168 rrstream_t *stream, dns_tsigkey_t *tsigkey,
1169 isc_buffer_t *lasttsig, bool verified_tsig,
1170 unsigned int maxtime, unsigned int idletime,
1171 bool many_answers, xfrout_ctx_t **xfrp)
1172{
1173 xfrout_ctx_t *xfr;
1174 isc_result_t result;
1175 unsigned int len;
1176 void *mem;
1177
1178 INSIST(xfrp != NULL && *xfrp == NULL);
1179 xfr = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*xfr));
1180 if (xfr == NULL)
1181 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
1182 xfr->mctx = NULL;
1183 isc_mem_attach(mctx, &xfr->mctx);
1184 xfr->client = NULL;
1185 ns_client_attach(client, &xfr->client);
1186 xfr->id = id;
1187 xfr->qname = qname;
1188 xfr->qtype = qtype;
1189 xfr->qclass = qclass;
1190 xfr->zone = NULL;
1191 xfr->db = NULL;
1192 xfr->ver = NULL;
1193 if (zone != NULL) /* zone will be NULL if it's DLZ */
1194 dns_zone_attach(zone, &xfr->zone);
1195 dns_db_attach(db, &xfr->db);
1196 dns_db_attachversion(db, ver, &xfr->ver);
1197 xfr->question_added = false;
1198 xfr->end_of_stream = false;
1199 xfr->tsigkey = tsigkey;
1200 xfr->lasttsig = lasttsig;
1201 xfr->verified_tsig = verified_tsig;
1202 xfr->many_answers = many_answers;
1203 xfr->sends = 0;
1204 xfr->shuttingdown = false;
1205 xfr->mnemonic = NULL;
1206 xfr->buf.base = NULL;
1207 xfr->buf.length = 0;
1208 xfr->txmem = NULL;
1209 xfr->txmemlen = 0;
1210 xfr->stream = NULL;
1211 xfr->quota = NULL;
1212
1213 xfr->stats.nmsg = 0;
1214 xfr->stats.nrecs = 0;
1215 xfr->stats.nbytes = 0;
1216 isc_time_now(&xfr->stats.start);
1217
1218 /*
1219 * Allocate a temporary buffer for the uncompressed response
1220 * message data. The size should be no more than 65535 bytes
1221 * so that the compressed data will fit in a TCP message,
1222 * and no less than 65535 bytes so that an almost maximum-sized
1223 * RR will fit. Note that although 65535-byte RRs are allowed
1224 * in principle, they cannot be zone-transferred (at least not
1225 * if uncompressible), because the message and RR headers would
1226 * push the size of the TCP message over the 65536 byte limit.
1227 */
1228 len = 65535;
1229 mem = isc_mem_get(mctx, len);
1230 if (mem == NULL) {
1231 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
1232 goto failure;
1233 }
1234 isc_buffer_init(&xfr->buf, mem, len);
1235
1236 /*
1237 * Allocate another temporary buffer for the compressed
1238 * response message and its TCP length prefix.
1239 */
1240 len = 2 + 65535;
1241 mem = isc_mem_get(mctx, len);
1242 if (mem == NULL) {
1243 result = ISC_R_NOMEMORY;
1244 goto failure;
1245 }
1246 isc_buffer_init(&xfr->txlenbuf, mem, 2);
1247 isc_buffer_init(&xfr->txbuf, (char *) mem + 2, len - 2);
1248 xfr->txmem = mem;
1249 xfr->txmemlen = len;
1250
1251 CHECK(dns_timer_setidle(xfr->client->timer,
1252 maxtime, idletime, false));
1253
1254 /*
1255 * Register a shutdown callback with the client, so that we
1256 * can stop the transfer immediately when the client task
1257 * gets a shutdown event.
1258 */
1259 xfr->client->shutdown = xfrout_client_shutdown;
1260 xfr->client->shutdown_arg = xfr;
1261 /*
1262 * These MUST be after the last "goto failure;" / CHECK to
1263 * prevent a double free by the caller.
1264 */
1265 xfr->quota = quota;
1266 xfr->stream = stream;
1267
1268 *xfrp = xfr;
1269 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1270
1271failure:
1272 xfrout_ctx_destroy(&xfr);
1273 return (result);
1274}
1275
1276
1277/*
1278 * Arrange to send as much as we can of "stream" without blocking.
1279 *
1280 * Requires:
1281 * The stream iterator is initialized and points at an RR,
1282 * or possibly at the end of the stream (that is, the
1283 * _first method of the iterator has been called).
1284 */
1285static void
1286sendstream(xfrout_ctx_t *xfr) {
1287 dns_message_t *tcpmsg = NULL;
1288 dns_message_t *msg = NULL; /* Client message if UDP, tcpmsg if TCP */
1289 isc_result_t result;
1290 isc_region_t used;
1291 isc_region_t region;
1292 dns_rdataset_t *qrdataset;
1293 dns_name_t *msgname = NULL;
1294 dns_rdata_t *msgrdata = NULL;
1295 dns_rdatalist_t *msgrdl = NULL;
1296 dns_rdataset_t *msgrds = NULL;
1297 dns_compress_t cctx;
1298 bool cleanup_cctx = false;
1299 bool is_tcp;
1300
1301 int n_rrs;
1302
1303 isc_buffer_clear(&xfr->buf);
1304 isc_buffer_clear(&xfr->txlenbuf);
1305 isc_buffer_clear(&xfr->txbuf);
1306
1307 is_tcp = ((xfr->client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP) != 0);
1308 if (!is_tcp) {
1309 /*
1310 * In the UDP case, we put the response data directly into
1311 * the client message.
1312 */
1313 msg = xfr->client->message;
1314 CHECK(dns_message_reply(msg, true));
1315 } else {
1316 /*
1317 * TCP. Build a response dns_message_t, temporarily storing
1318 * the raw, uncompressed owner names and RR data contiguously
1319 * in xfr->buf. We know that if the uncompressed data fits
1320 * in xfr->buf, the compressed data will surely fit in a TCP
1321 * message.
1322 */
1323
1324 CHECK(dns_message_create(xfr->mctx,
1325 DNS_MESSAGE_INTENTRENDER, &tcpmsg));
1326 msg = tcpmsg;
1327
1328 msg->id = xfr->id;
1329 msg->rcode = dns_rcode_noerror;
1330 msg->flags = DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_QR | DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_AA;
1331 if ((xfr->client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_RA) != 0)
1332 msg->flags |= DNS_MESSAGEFLAG_RA;
1333 CHECK(dns_message_settsigkey(msg, xfr->tsigkey));
1334 CHECK(dns_message_setquerytsig(msg, xfr->lasttsig));
1335 if (xfr->lasttsig != NULL)
1336 isc_buffer_free(&xfr->lasttsig);
1337 msg->verified_sig = xfr->verified_tsig;
1338
1339 /*
1340 * Add a EDNS option to the message?
1341 */
1342 if ((xfr->client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTOPT) != 0) {
1343 dns_rdataset_t *opt = NULL;
1344
1345 CHECK(ns_client_addopt(xfr->client, msg, &opt));
1346 CHECK(dns_message_setopt(msg, opt));
1347 /*
1348 * Add to first message only.
1349 */
1350 xfr->client->attributes &= ~NS_CLIENTATTR_WANTNSID;
1351 xfr->client->attributes &= ~NS_CLIENTATTR_HAVEEXPIRE;
1352 }
1353
1354 /*
1355 * Account for reserved space.
1356 */
1357 if (xfr->tsigkey != NULL)
1358 INSIST(msg->reserved != 0U);
1359 isc_buffer_add(&xfr->buf, msg->reserved);
1360
1361 /*
1362 * Include a question section in the first message only.
1363 * BIND 8.2.1 will not recognize an IXFR if it does not
1364 * have a question section.
1365 */
1366 if (!xfr->question_added) {
1367 dns_name_t *qname = NULL;
1368 isc_region_t r;
1369
1370 /*
1371 * Reserve space for the 12-byte message header
1372 * and 4 bytes of question.
1373 */
1374 isc_buffer_add(&xfr->buf, 12 + 4);
1375
1376 qrdataset = NULL;
1377 result = dns_message_gettemprdataset(msg, &qrdataset);
1378 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1379 goto failure;
1380 dns_rdataset_makequestion(qrdataset,
1381 xfr->client->message->rdclass,
1382 xfr->qtype);
1383
1384 result = dns_message_gettempname(msg, &qname);
1385 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1386 goto failure;
1387 dns_name_init(qname, NULL);
1388 isc_buffer_availableregion(&xfr->buf, &r);
1389 INSIST(r.length >= xfr->qname->length);
1390 r.length = xfr->qname->length;
1391 isc_buffer_putmem(&xfr->buf, xfr->qname->ndata,
1392 xfr->qname->length);
1393 dns_name_fromregion(qname, &r);
1394 ISC_LIST_INIT(qname->list);
1395 ISC_LIST_APPEND(qname->list, qrdataset, link);
1396
1397 dns_message_addname(msg, qname, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION);
1398 xfr->question_added = true;
1399 } else {
1400 /*
1401 * Reserve space for the 12-byte message header
1402 */
1403 isc_buffer_add(&xfr->buf, 12);
1404 msg->tcp_continuation = 1;
1405 }
1406 }
1407
1408 /*
1409 * Try to fit in as many RRs as possible, unless "one-answer"
1410 * format has been requested.
1411 */
1412 for (n_rrs = 0; ; n_rrs++) {
1413 dns_name_t *name = NULL;
1414 uint32_t ttl;
1415 dns_rdata_t *rdata = NULL;
1416
1417 unsigned int size;
1418 isc_region_t r;
1419
1420 msgname = NULL;
1421 msgrdata = NULL;
1422 msgrdl = NULL;
1423 msgrds = NULL;
1424
1425 xfr->stream->methods->current(xfr->stream,
1426 &name, &ttl, &rdata);
1427 size = name->length + 10 + rdata->length;
1428 isc_buffer_availableregion(&xfr->buf, &r);
1429 if (size >= r.length) {
1430 /*
1431 * RR would not fit. If there are other RRs in the
1432 * buffer, send them now and leave this RR to the
1433 * next message. If this RR overflows the buffer
1434 * all by itself, fail.
1435 *
1436 * In theory some RRs might fit in a TCP message
1437 * when compressed even if they do not fit when
1438 * uncompressed, but surely we don't want
1439 * to send such monstrosities to an unsuspecting
1440 * slave.
1441 */
1442 if (n_rrs == 0) {
1443 xfrout_log(xfr, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
1444 "RR too large for zone transfer "
1445 "(%d bytes)", size);
1446 /* XXX DNS_R_RRTOOLARGE? */
1447 result = ISC_R_NOSPACE;
1448 goto failure;
1449 }
1450 break;
1451 }
1452
1453 if (isc_log_wouldlog(ns_lctx, XFROUT_RR_LOGLEVEL))
1454 log_rr(name, rdata, ttl); /* XXX */
1455
1456 result = dns_message_gettempname(msg, &msgname);
1457 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1458 goto failure;
1459 dns_name_init(msgname, NULL);
1460 isc_buffer_availableregion(&xfr->buf, &r);
1461 INSIST(r.length >= name->length);
1462 r.length = name->length;
1463 isc_buffer_putmem(&xfr->buf, name->ndata, name->length);
1464 dns_name_fromregion(msgname, &r);
1465
1466 /* Reserve space for RR header. */
1467 isc_buffer_add(&xfr->buf, 10);
1468
1469 result = dns_message_gettemprdata(msg, &msgrdata);
1470 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1471 goto failure;
1472 isc_buffer_availableregion(&xfr->buf, &r);
1473 r.length = rdata->length;
1474 isc_buffer_putmem(&xfr->buf, rdata->data, rdata->length);
1475 dns_rdata_init(msgrdata);
1476 dns_rdata_fromregion(msgrdata,
1477 rdata->rdclass, rdata->type, &r);
1478
1479 result = dns_message_gettemprdatalist(msg, &msgrdl);
1480 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1481 goto failure;
1482 msgrdl->type = rdata->type;
1483 msgrdl->rdclass = rdata->rdclass;
1484 msgrdl->ttl = ttl;
1485 if (rdata->type == dns_rdatatype_sig ||
1486 rdata->type == dns_rdatatype_rrsig)
1487 msgrdl->covers = dns_rdata_covers(rdata);
1488 else
1489 msgrdl->covers = dns_rdatatype_none;
1490 ISC_LIST_APPEND(msgrdl->rdata, msgrdata, link);
1491
1492 result = dns_message_gettemprdataset(msg, &msgrds);
1493 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1494 goto failure;
1495 result = dns_rdatalist_tordataset(msgrdl, msgrds);
1496 INSIST(result == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1497
1498 ISC_LIST_APPEND(msgname->list, msgrds, link);
1499
1500 dns_message_addname(msg, msgname, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER);
1501 msgname = NULL;
1502
1503 xfr->stats.nrecs++;
1504
1505 result = xfr->stream->methods->next(xfr->stream);
1506 if (result == ISC_R_NOMORE) {
1507 xfr->end_of_stream = true;
1508 break;
1509 }
1510 CHECK(result);
1511
1512 if (! xfr->many_answers)
1513 break;
1514 /*
1515 * At this stage, at least 1 RR has been rendered into
1516 * the message. Check if we want to clamp this message
1517 * here (TCP only).
1518 */
1519 if ((isc_buffer_usedlength(&xfr->buf) >=
1520 xfr->client->sctx->transfer_tcp_message_size) && is_tcp)
1521 break;
1522 }
1523
1524 if (is_tcp) {
1525 CHECK(dns_compress_init(&cctx, -1, xfr->mctx));
1526 dns_compress_setsensitive(&cctx, true);
1527 cleanup_cctx = true;
1528 CHECK(dns_message_renderbegin(msg, &cctx, &xfr->txbuf));
1529 CHECK(dns_message_rendersection(msg, DNS_SECTION_QUESTION, 0));
1530 CHECK(dns_message_rendersection(msg, DNS_SECTION_ANSWER, 0));
1531 CHECK(dns_message_renderend(msg));
1532 dns_compress_invalidate(&cctx);
1533 cleanup_cctx = false;
1534
1535 isc_buffer_usedregion(&xfr->txbuf, &used);
1536 isc_buffer_putuint16(&xfr->txlenbuf,
1537 (uint16_t)used.length);
1538 region.base = xfr->txlenbuf.base;
1539 region.length = 2 + used.length;
1540 xfrout_log(xfr, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(8),
1541 "sending TCP message of %d bytes",
1542 used.length);
1543 CHECK(isc_socket_send(xfr->client->tcpsocket, /* XXX */
1544 &region, xfr->client->task,
1545 xfrout_senddone,
1546 xfr));
1547 xfr->sends++;
1548 } else {
1549 xfrout_log(xfr, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(8), "sending IXFR UDP response");
1550 ns_client_send(xfr->client);
1551 xfr->stream->methods->pause(xfr->stream);
1552 xfrout_ctx_destroy(&xfr);
1553 return;
1554 }
1555
1556 /* Advance lasttsig to be the last TSIG generated */
1557 CHECK(dns_message_getquerytsig(msg, xfr->mctx, &xfr->lasttsig));
1558
1559 failure:
1560 if (msgname != NULL) {
1561 if (msgrds != NULL) {
1562 if (dns_rdataset_isassociated(msgrds))
1563 dns_rdataset_disassociate(msgrds);
1564 dns_message_puttemprdataset(msg, &msgrds);
1565 }
1566 if (msgrdl != NULL) {
1567 ISC_LIST_UNLINK(msgrdl->rdata, msgrdata, link);
1568 dns_message_puttemprdatalist(msg, &msgrdl);
1569 }
1570 if (msgrdata != NULL)
1571 dns_message_puttemprdata(msg, &msgrdata);
1572 dns_message_puttempname(msg, &msgname);
1573 }
1574
1575 if (tcpmsg != NULL)
1576 dns_message_destroy(&tcpmsg);
1577
1578 if (cleanup_cctx)
1579 dns_compress_invalidate(&cctx);
1580 /*
1581 * Make sure to release any locks held by database
1582 * iterators before returning from the event handler.
1583 */
1584 xfr->stream->methods->pause(xfr->stream);
1585
1586 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1587 return;
1588
1589 xfrout_fail(xfr, result, "sending zone data");
1590}
1591
1592static void
1593xfrout_ctx_destroy(xfrout_ctx_t **xfrp) {
1594 xfrout_ctx_t *xfr = *xfrp;
1595 ns_client_t *client = NULL;
1596
1597 INSIST(xfr->sends == 0);
1598
1599 xfr->client->shutdown = NULL;
1600 xfr->client->shutdown_arg = NULL;
1601
1602 if (xfr->stream != NULL)
1603 xfr->stream->methods->destroy(&xfr->stream);
1604 if (xfr->buf.base != NULL)
1605 isc_mem_put(xfr->mctx, xfr->buf.base, xfr->buf.length);
1606 if (xfr->txmem != NULL)
1607 isc_mem_put(xfr->mctx, xfr->txmem, xfr->txmemlen);
1608 if (xfr->lasttsig != NULL)
1609 isc_buffer_free(&xfr->lasttsig);
1610 if (xfr->quota != NULL)
1611 isc_quota_detach(&xfr->quota);
1612 if (xfr->ver != NULL)
1613 dns_db_closeversion(xfr->db, &xfr->ver, false);
1614 if (xfr->zone != NULL)
1615 dns_zone_detach(&xfr->zone);
1616 if (xfr->db != NULL)
1617 dns_db_detach(&xfr->db);
1618
1619 /*
1620 * We want to detch the client after we have released the memory
1621 * context as ns_client_detach checks the memory reference count.
1622 */
1623 ns_client_attach(xfr->client, &client);
1624 ns_client_detach(&xfr->client);
1625 isc_mem_putanddetach(&xfr->mctx, xfr, sizeof(*xfr));
1626 ns_client_detach(&client);
1627
1628 *xfrp = NULL;
1629}
1630
1631static void
1632xfrout_senddone(isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t *event) {
1633 isc_socketevent_t *sev = (isc_socketevent_t *)event;
1634 xfrout_ctx_t *xfr = (xfrout_ctx_t *)event->ev_arg;
1635 isc_result_t evresult = sev->result;
1636
1637 UNUSED(task);
1638
1639 INSIST(event->ev_type == ISC_SOCKEVENT_SENDDONE);
1640 INSIST((xfr->client->attributes & NS_CLIENTATTR_TCP) != 0);
1641
1642 xfr->sends--;
1643 INSIST(xfr->sends == 0);
1644
1645 /*
1646 * Update transfer statistics if sending succeeded, accounting for the
1647 * two-byte TCP length prefix included in the number of bytes sent.
1648 */
1649 if (evresult == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1650 xfr->stats.nmsg++;
1651 xfr->stats.nbytes += sev->region.length - 2;
1652 }
1653
1654 isc_event_free(&event);
1655
1656 (void)isc_timer_touch(xfr->client->timer);
1657 if (xfr->shuttingdown == true) {
1658 xfrout_maybe_destroy(xfr);
1659 } else if (evresult != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1660 xfrout_fail(xfr, evresult, "send");
1661 } else if (xfr->end_of_stream == false) {
1662 sendstream(xfr);
1663 } else {
1664 /* End of zone transfer stream. */
1665 uint64_t msecs, persec;
1666
1667 inc_stats(xfr->client, xfr->zone, ns_statscounter_xfrdone);
1668 isc_time_now(&xfr->stats.end);
1669 msecs = isc_time_microdiff(&xfr->stats.end, &xfr->stats.start);
1670 msecs /= 1000;
1671 if (msecs == 0) {
1672 msecs = 1;
1673 }
1674 persec = (xfr->stats.nbytes * 1000) / msecs;
1675 xfrout_log(xfr, ISC_LOG_INFO,
1676 "%s ended: "
1677 "%" PRIu64 " messages, %" PRIu64 " records, "
1678 "%" PRIu64 " bytes, "
1679 "%u.%03u secs (%u bytes/sec)",
1680 xfr->mnemonic,
1681 xfr->stats.nmsg, xfr->stats.nrecs,
1682 xfr->stats.nbytes,
1683 (unsigned int) (msecs / 1000),
1684 (unsigned int) (msecs % 1000),
1685 (unsigned int) persec);
1686
1687 ns_client_next(xfr->client, ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1688 xfrout_ctx_destroy(&xfr);
1689 }
1690}
1691
1692static void
1693xfrout_fail(xfrout_ctx_t *xfr, isc_result_t result, const char *msg) {
1694 xfr->shuttingdown = true;
1695 xfrout_log(xfr, ISC_LOG_ERROR, "%s: %s",
1696 msg, isc_result_totext(result));
1697 xfrout_maybe_destroy(xfr);
1698}
1699
1700static void
1701xfrout_maybe_destroy(xfrout_ctx_t *xfr) {
1702 INSIST(xfr->shuttingdown == true);
1703 if (xfr->sends > 0) {
1704 /*
1705 * If we are currently sending, cancel it and wait for
1706 * cancel event before destroying the context.
1707 */
1708 isc_socket_cancel(xfr->client->tcpsocket, xfr->client->task,
1709 ISC_SOCKCANCEL_SEND);
1710 } else {
1711 ns_client_next(xfr->client, ISC_R_CANCELED);
1712 xfrout_ctx_destroy(&xfr);
1713 }
1714}
1715
1716static void
1717xfrout_client_shutdown(void *arg, isc_result_t result) {
1718 xfrout_ctx_t *xfr = (xfrout_ctx_t *) arg;
1719 xfrout_fail(xfr, result, "aborted");
1720}
1721
1722/*
1723 * Log outgoing zone transfer messages in a format like
1724 * <client>: transfer of <zone>: <message>
1725 */
1726
1727static void
1728xfrout_logv(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t *zonename,
1729 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass, int level, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
1730 ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(5, 0);
1731
1732static void
1733xfrout_logv(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t *zonename,
1734 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass, int level, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
1735{
1736 char msgbuf[2048];
1737 char namebuf[DNS_NAME_FORMATSIZE];
1738 char classbuf[DNS_RDATACLASS_FORMATSIZE];
1739
1740 dns_name_format(zonename, namebuf, sizeof(namebuf));
1741 dns_rdataclass_format(rdclass, classbuf, sizeof(classbuf));
1742 vsnprintf(msgbuf, sizeof(msgbuf), fmt, ap);
1743 ns_client_log(client, DNS_LOGCATEGORY_XFER_OUT,
1744 NS_LOGMODULE_XFER_OUT, level,
1745 "transfer of '%s/%s': %s", namebuf, classbuf, msgbuf);
1746}
1747
1748/*
1749 * Logging function for use when a xfrout_ctx_t has not yet been created.
1750 */
1751static void
1752xfrout_log1(ns_client_t *client, dns_name_t *zonename,
1753 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass, int level, const char *fmt, ...) {
1754 va_list ap;
1755 va_start(ap, fmt);
1756 xfrout_logv(client, zonename, rdclass, level, fmt, ap);
1757 va_end(ap);
1758}
1759
1760/*
1761 * Logging function for use when there is a xfrout_ctx_t.
1762 */
1763static void
1764xfrout_log(xfrout_ctx_t *xfr, int level, const char *fmt, ...) {
1765 va_list ap;
1766 va_start(ap, fmt);
1767 xfrout_logv(xfr->client, xfr->qname, xfr->qclass, level, fmt, ap);
1768 va_end(ap);
1769}
